title: How to Make a Pebble Boot Tray

steps.headline: Place the tray on a newspaper covered work surface.
steps.description: If the boot tray needs cleaning, do so now and dry thoroughly before proceeding.

steps.headline: Decide whether you want to make a pattern with the pebbles or just add them randomly.
steps.description:
If making a pattern, you could do something like these suggestions: Add different shades of pebbles in varying ways, such as stripes, wavy stripes, geometric shapes, etc. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Design a letter, number or symbol in the center or across the pebbles; use differently colored pebbles to make it obvious. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/26/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/26/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}

steps.headline: Use the glue to attach the pebbles.
Continue until all the pebbles are in place.
steps.description: When you near the end, it is a good idea to test which pebbles will fit before adding the glue, as there may be some rearranging required before everything will fit neatly. Try not to leave large gaps!

steps.headline: Let dry for at least 24 hours before going to the next step.
steps.description: Also follow the manufacturer's instructions with respect to time.

steps.headline: Apply a sealant.
steps.description: Paint or spray a suitable sealant across the top of the pebbles.

steps.headline: Place the pebble boot tray in your mudroom or entrance way.
steps.description: Encourage all members of the household to place their muddy, wet or snow-covered boots and shoes on the tray to drain.

steps.headline: Keep the tray clean.
steps.description: Wipe down and wash it regularly. It may also need to be drained every few days if water has amassed in it from melting snow, etc.

text:
Making the pebble boot tray Place the tray on a newspaper covered work surface. If the boot tray needs cleaning, do so now and dry thoroughly before proceeding. Decide whether you want to make a pattern with the pebbles or just add them randomly. If making a pattern, you could do something like these suggestions: Add different shades of pebbles in varying ways, such as stripes, wavy stripes, geometric shapes, etc. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Design a letter, number or symbol in the center or across the pebbles; use differently colored pebbles to make it obvious. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/26/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/26/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use the glue to attach the pebbles. Work in small sections at a time, starting at a corner edge and working methodically across the tray. Paint a small area of the tray's corner with glue, then add a dab of glue to each pebble. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9c/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9c/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Press the pebble in place. Keep the pebble as flat as possible––the surface should not be too bumpy for the boots and shoes to sit on. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/51/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/51/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Repeat for each pebble in that section. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Move onto the next section. Move across and add pebbles according to your pattern or randomly. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Pebble-Boot-Tray-Step-3Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Continue until all the pebbles are in place. When you near the end, it is a good idea to test which pebbles will fit before adding the glue, as there may be some rearranging required before everything will fit neatly. Try not to leave large gaps! Let dry for at least 24 hours before going to the next step. Also follow the manufacturer's instructions with respect to time. Apply a sealant. Paint or spray a suitable sealant across the top of the pebbles. Using the pebble boot tray Place the pebble boot tray in your mudroom or entrance way. Encourage all members of the household to place their muddy, wet or snow-covered boots and shoes on the tray to drain. Keep the tray clean. Wipe down and wash it regularly. It may also need to be drained every few days if water has amassed in it from melting snow, etc.
